meanings.definition: To provide a new house or place of residence for (someone)
meanings.sent1: The kind family rehouses the stray cat in a cozy shelter.
meanings.sent2: The organization rehouses families affected by natural disasters.
meanings.sent3: The magical fairy rehouses the lost toys in a secret garden.
meanings.sent4: The moving company rehouses memories into sturdy boxes.
meanings.sent5: The architect rehouses dreams into beautiful homes.

meanings.definition: To move (someone or something) to a new house or place of residence
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent rehouses the family to a bigger home.
meanings.sent2: The government rehouses refugees in safe communities.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rehouses the squeaky toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The river rehouses the fish downstream to a cooler spot.
meanings.sent5: The wind rehouses the fallen leaves to different corners of the garden.
